intro: Tithymalus densiusculus, commonly known as the dense hairy tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant has finely hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
